#WFH Tip: Set clear boundaries around the hours you work. This is important so that you don’t find yourself working every waking moment, but also so that others at home understand when you're at work. #WFHTips #workingfromhome
#WFH Tip: Try and set clear boundaries around where you work. If you need to work in a common area, have some sort of symbol that reminds you and others that “I’m working”. #WFHTips #workingfromhome

#WFH Tip: Create some rituals around working from home. My friend Sue has also worked from home for years, and every morning she gets dressed in work clothes and puts on makeup. #WFHTips #workingfromhome
#WFH Tip: Make time to talk to real people every day. Think about how you can use video calling such as Facetime and Zoom instead of relying on email or instant messaging. #WFHTips #workingfromhome

#WFH Tip: Make time to exercise and move! An easy way to increase your steps is to walk when you’re on the phone. For me, a 10-minute phone call is equal to about 1,000 steps. #WFHTips #workingfromhome
